required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison Between Vaginal Pessary and Progestogen in Twin Pregnancy With Short Cervical Length
clinical_study.official_title: Randomised Controlled Trial Comparing Vaginal Pessary and Progestogen as an Intervention in Twin Pregnancy With Short Cervical Length to Prevent Spontaneous Preterm Birth

brief_summary.textblock: A randomized clinical trial comparing vaginal progestogen and vaginal pessary as an intervention for twin pregnancies with short cervical length.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a randomized controlled trial to compare women with twin pregnancies and diagnosed with asymptomatic short cervical length. Two types of interventions will be compared i.e vaginal progestogen and vaginal pessary.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: All women with twin pregnancies will be screened for suitability via measurement of the cervical length at 20 to 24 weeks gestation. Those with a cervical length of 30mm or less will be recruited into the study.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion up to 37 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Mean gestational age at delivery in weeks

secondary_outcome.description: Mean maternal age in years
Percentage of each race recruited
Mean maternal body mass index in kg/m2 before pregnancy or in the first trimester
Mean number of parity
Chorionicity of twin pregnancy
Method of conception
Mean gestational age at recruitment in weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Gestational age at commencement of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Mean gestational age at commencement of treatment in weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Cervical length before commencement of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Mean cervical length before commencement of treatment in mm
Percentage of participants with vaginal infection prior to commencement of treatment
Percentage of participants with previous first and second trimester miscarriages
Percentage of participants with pre-existing medical disorders
Percentage of participants with previous spontaneous preterm birth

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion up to 37 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with antenatal complications

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion up to 37 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with fetal complications

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion up to 37 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants who delivered vaginally or via caesarean section

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Throughout labour up to delivery of the neonate
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with intrapartum complications

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through delivery of neonate up to 42 days after delivery
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with postpartum complications

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through delivery of neonate up to 42 days after delivery
secondary_outcome.description: Mean total blood loss in ml
Mean birth weight in grams
Mean Apgar score
Mean length and head circumference of neonates at birth in cm

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately after birth of neonate up to discharge (approximately 30 days)
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of neonates required Neonatal intensive care unit admission

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration in neonatal intensive care unit
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through neonatal intensive care unit stay up to discharge (approximately 30 days)
secondary_outcome.description: Mean duration in neonatal intensive care unit in days

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately after birth up to 30 days
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of neonates with complications

arm_group.description: 200mg of vaginal progestogen will be inserted before bedtime every day from time of recruitment until 34 weeks gestation.
Vaginal pessary with an internal diameter size of 32 or 35 mm will be inserted at the time of recruitment and kept until 34 weeks gestation.

intervention.description: A diary will be given to participants to ensure compliance.
The internal diameter size will be decided based on the clinical assessment of the cervix.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- all twin pregnancies
- cervical length less than 30mm
Exclusion Criteria:
- Twin to twin transfusion syndrome
- Stillbirth
- congenital anomaly in one of the fetuses
- previous cervical trauma or surgery
- cervical cerclage in current pregnancy
- premature labour with or without rupture of membranes
- severe vaginal discharge
- acute vaginitis or cervicitis
